snippet: At least 78 Palestinians were said to have died as of Thursday, while rocket attacks from Gaza reached new areas in Israel.
abstract: Third day of Israeli airstrikes in Gaza leaves at least 78 Palestinians dead, many of them civilians, increasing likelihood of ground invasion and prompting United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon to call urgently for a return to calm and cease-fire.

byline.contributor: Fares Akram contributed reporting from Gaza, Somini Sengupta from the United Nations, and Michael D. Shear from Washington.

lead_paragraph: At least 78 Palestinians were said to have died as of Thursday, while rocket attacks from Gaza reached new areas in Israel.

headline.main: Gaza Deaths Spike in 3rd Day of Air Assaults While Rockets Hit Israel
headline.print_headline: Gaza Deaths Spike in 3rd Day of Air Assaults While Rockets Hit Israel
